iaik.security.md

Class SHA3_384

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.security.MessageDigestSpi
      • java.security.MessageDigest
        • iaik.security.md.SHA3_384

  • public final class SHA3_384
extends java.security.MessageDigest
    This class implements the SHA-3 message digest algorithm for calculating a 384-bit hash value.

    NIST (FIPS PUB 202) specifies the Secure Hash Algorithm-3 (SHA-3) family of message digest algorithms as supplement of the SHA-1 and SHA-2 message digest algorithm family. SHA-3 is based on the KECCAK message digest algorithm but is not fully identical to KECCAK because it adds a suffix to the message to ensure domain separation between the SHA-3 hash function and the newly specified SHA-3 extendable-output function (XOF). The XOF allows the output to be extended to any desired length.

    This class implements the SHA3-384 hash function that produces a 384-bit hash-value of the given input data. Since SHA3-384 and KECCAK384 are not identical a SHA3-384 MessageDigest engine will produce a different output than a KECCAK384 MessageDigest engine. To ensure to use the NIST standardized version, specify SHA3-384 as algorithm name when instantiating a SHA3-384 MessageDigest engine: 

     MessageDigest sha3 = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA3-384");

    After having created the MessageDigest engine, you can supply the data to be hashed by one or more calls to one of the update methods, e.g: 

         sha3.update(m1);
     sha3.update(m2);
     ...

  • Finally, the hash value can be computed using one of the digest methods: 
     byte[] hash_value = sha3.digest();

There are several ways for combining update and digest methods for computing a message digest. When the hash value successfully has been computed, the SHA-3 MessageDigest object automatically resets for being able to be supplied with new data to be hashed.

See Also:
MessageDigest
